--- title: "Marine Spatial Planning Project - Scope of Work and Deliverables" date: "2025-12-27" date-modified: today toc: true execute: echo: false warning: false message: false comment: "" --- ::: {.cell} ::: ## Marine Spatial Planning **Location**: Mkoani (Pemba) and Mkuranga (Pwani Region), Tanzania --- ## Project Overview This Marine Spatial Planning project aims to develop comprehensive spatial plans for sustainable coastal and marine resource management in Mkoani and Mkuranga districts. The initiative integrates scientific research, stakeholder engagement, and participatory planning to support evidence-based marine governance and blue economy development. ::: {style="position: relative; display: inline-block; width: 100%; float: right; margin-left: 20px; margin-bottom: 15px;"} ![](images/components/iga2.jpg){fig-alt="Stakeholder validation and engagement" .img-fluid style="border-radius: 10px; box-shadow: 0 4px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.1); display: block; width: 100%;"} ::: {style="position: absolute; bottom: 15px; left: 15px; right: 15px; background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4); color: white; padding: 12px 15px; border-radius: 8px; font-size: 14px; font-weight: 500; backdrop-filter: blur(5px);"} **Collaborative Marine Spatial Planning:** Stakeholders and community leaders engage in participatory discussions to shape sustainable management strategies for coastal Tanzania ::: ::: --- ## Scope of Work and Deliverables ### 1. Inception Report **Target Completion Date**: 15 September 2025 **Objectives**: Establish project foundations, clarify roles and responsibilities, and align stakeholders on project goals and implementation approach. ::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} **Deliverable**: A detailed inception report including: - Comprehensive project methodology and approach - Detailed activity schedule and timeline - Data requirements and collection protocols - Stakeholder engagement and consultation plan - Institutional coordination framework ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: ::: --- ### 2. Biodiversity Assessment and Trend Analysis **Target Completion Date**: 25 January 2026 **Lead**: Siajali Pamba under guidance of Masumbuko Semba **Objectives**: Establish baseline biodiversity conditions and identify temporal trends to inform conservation priorities. **Deliverable**: A report on data collection, detailed maps and ground truthing, showing: ::: {.columns} ::: {.column} - Decadal trends in biodiversity loss and gain across Tanzania (focusing on mangrove ecosystems) - Regional context and significance for marine conservation - Spatial distribution maps of key biodiversity indicators - Ground-truthed field observations and validation data - High-resolution geospatial mapping of mangrove loss/gain trends for coastal districts - Restoration priority areas for carbon offset schemes and climate mitigation ::: ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: ::: --- ### 3. Field Data Collection and Mapping **Target Completion Date**: 25 January 2026 **Lead**: Masumbuko Semba with guidance from Siajali Pamba **Objectives**: Collect primary data across multiple disciplines and develop spatial datasets to support planning decisions. **Deliverable**: Comprehensive field data collection and map layer development: ::: {.columns} ::: {.column} - **Physical data**: Bathymetry, coastal morphology, oceanographic parameters, seabed morphology, ocean currents, sea level trends, salinity, temperature, acidification, upwelling zones - **Biological data**: Fish populations, coral reef conditions, seagrass beds, biodiversity hotspots, mangroves, critical fish habitats, migratory corridors (turtles, sharks) - **Geomorphological data**: Habitat classifications, erosion zones, ecosystem boundaries - **Socioeconomic data**: Fisher demographics, livelihood patterns, resource use intensity, settlements, infrastructure, tourism hubs - **Marine resource use data**: Fishing effort distribution, gear types, seasonal patterns, aquaculture/mariculture zones, fish landing sites, CFMAs, CMAs, BMUs ::: ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: ::: **Data Sources**: ESA data (10m resolution), NAFORMA, TAN-Sea map, ECAS data, TPDC (oil and gas), open street maps, Frame survey data --- ### 4. Ecosystem Services Valuation **Target Completion Date**: 31 March 2026 **Lead**: Gervas Maro with assistance from Julius Francis **Objectives**: Quantify the economic value of marine ecosystems to support conservation and sustainable use arguments. **Deliverable**: A comprehensive economic valuation report including: ::: {.columns} ::: {.column} - Baseline valuation of coastal and marine ecosystem goods and services in USD - Spatial mapping of classified ecosystem assets and service categories - Classification and cataloging of coastal and marine assets with focus on key habitats (mangroves, coral, seagrasses, beaches) - Ecosystem services analysis through comparative risk analysis: - Provisioning services (food provisioning from marine fish catch, mariculture, agriculture, raw materials, fuelwood, timber) - Regulating/supporting services (carbon sequestration, habitat maintenance, regulation of extreme events) - Cultural services (tourism, recreation, ecotourism) ::: ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: ::: --- ### 5. Bio-Economic Cost-Benefit Analysis **Target Completion Date**: 31 March 2026 **Lead**: Emmanuel Mpina with inputs from project team members **Objectives**: Demonstrate the economic case for sustainable marine management and identify financing pathways aligned with national priorities. **Deliverable**: A detailed cost-benefit analysis report evaluating proposed bioeconomic activities: ::: {.columns} ::: {.column} - Financial feasibility assessments for: - New Marine Protected Areas (MPAs) - Carbon offset co-managed sites - Octopus closure sites - Seaweed farming plots - Pelagic anchovies (dagaa) initiatives - Alternative livelihoods (e.g., seaweed farming, eco-tourism) - Proposed green and blue finance instruments for funding: - Local tax mechanisms - Private investor partnerships - Climate finance instruments - Conservation trust funds - Payment for ecosystem services schemes ::: ::: {.column} - Policy guidance to support: - Blue economy growth and diversification - Biodiversity conservation and ecosystem restoration - Ecosystem resilience and climate adaptation - Alignment with national climate action plans and SDGs - Upscaling of successful initiatives ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: ::: --- ### 6. Interactive Digital Visualization Platform **Target Completion Date**: 1 December 2025 - 15 April 2026 **Lead**: Masumbuko Semba and Emmanuel Mpina **Objectives**: Make complex spatial and economic data accessible and actionable for diverse stakeholders. **Deliverable**: An integrated digital visualization tool featuring: ::: {.columns} ::: {.column} - **Web Maps**: Geospatial visualizations displaying: - Degraded hotspots in Tanzania requiring restoration - Marine biodiversity loss and gain spatial trends - State of Mkuranga and Mkoani districts showing physical features, ecological assets, and health indicators - Ecosystem valuation data and economic analysis results - Cost-benefit analysis for implementation of environmental and socioeconomic measures - Blue economy initiatives and innovations - **District Focus**: Detailed visualizations and statistics for Mkuranga and Mkoani: - Ecosystem status indicators - Biodiversity patterns and trends - Ecosystem service spatial distribution ::: ::: {.column} - Socioeconomic context and livelihood dependencies - Climate vulnerability assessments - Areas of potential marine resource-use conflicts - Community-priority conservation areas and fisheries closure areas - Blue carbon opportunities ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: ::: --- ## Timeline Summary | Deliverable | Due Date | Status | |-------------|----------|--------| | 1. Inception Report | 15 September 2025 | Completed | | 2.
